block.p: $500 Million Pledged To Fight Child Obesity The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation plans to spend more than $500 million over the next five years to reverse the increase in childhood obesity in one of the largest public health initiatives ever tried by a private philanthropy.
The Mayor's Appetite Michael R. Bloomberg has taken on more food issues, and provoked more controversy, than any other New York mayor.

Tennessee Is a Champ Again Candace Parker scored 17 points and was named the Final Four's outstanding player as Tennessee defeated Rutgers, 59-46, to win the N.C.A.A. women's basketball championship. It was Tennessee's seventh title over all but its first since 1998.
